articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Major U.S. airlines ordered ground stops on Friday citing communications issues, while other carriers, media companies, banks and telecoms firms around the world also reported system outages were disrupting their operations.
articles.title: Global cyber outage grounds flights and disrupts businesses

articles.author: Joseph Ax, Nathan Layne, Helen Coster
articles.description: Donald Trump accepted the Republican presidential nomination with a marathon speech that began with an uncharacteristic call for national unity before veering into his familiar mix of grievance, bombast and apocalyptic warnings about the country's fate if he is not returned to the White House.
articles.title: Trump clings to grievances in convention finale while Biden weighs future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian prosecutors at the trial of U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich on Friday requested that he be jailed for 18 years on charges of spying, Russian news agencies reported.
articles.title: Russian prosecutor seeks 18-year sentence for US journalist Gershkovich

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: The United Nations' highest court is set to issue an advisory opinion Friday on the legal ramifications of Israel's occupation of the Palestinian territories, weighing in on one of the world's most contentious issues at the request of the U.N. General Assembly.
articles.title: Top UN court to deliver opinion on Israel's occupation of Palestinian territories

articles.author: Vivian Sequera
articles.description: Organizational decisions by Venezuela's electoral authorities – from polling station staffing to the lay-out of the ballot - have been made with the intention of confusing voters and creating obstacles to a free presidential election on July 28, say opposition figures and analysts.
articles.title: Venezuela election organization is designed to confuse voters, opposition says

articles.author: Inti Landauro
articles.description: Begona Gomez, the wife of Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez, appeared before a judge on Friday but declined to answer questions about corruption and influence peddling accusations in a case that led her husband to consider resigning in April.
articles.title: Wife of Spain's PM declines to testify in corruption case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Telecommunications were widely disrupted in Bangladesh on Friday amid violent student protests against quotas for government jobs in which nearly two dozen people have been killed this week.
articles.title: Communications widely disrupted in Bangladesh as student protests spike

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: For four nights at Donald Trump's nominating convention in Milwaukee, a roster of speakers attempted to give one of the most divisive politicians in recent U.S. history a makeover, describing him as a loving and caring family man whose near-assassination at a rally on Saturday had changed him.
articles.title: Trump tramples on Republican Party effort to give him image makeover

articles.author: Ariba Shahid
articles.description: Pakistan will focus on meeting its external financing needs by speaking with foreign governments and lenders to draw foreign investment as well as seeking loan rollovers, the country's finance minister told Reuters on Friday, as his government prepares to execute its new $7 billion International Monetary Fund agreement.
articles.title: Pakistan is looking for external financing avenues, finance minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy addressed British government ministers on Friday, a rare appearance by a foreign leader at a cabinet meeting that new Prime Minister Keir Starmer hopes will underline London's support for Kyiv.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy attends UK cabinet, renews calls on long-range missiles
